pkgmetadata.longdescription: Partitioning Hierarchical Diversity and Differentiation Across Metrics and Scales, from Genes to Ecosystems // Miscellaneous R functions for calculating and decomposing multiple hierarchical diversity metrics, including hierarchical allele richness (q=1), hierarchical exponential Shannon entropy (q=1), hierarchical heterozygosity (q=2) and genetic differentiation (Fst and Delta D). This package allows you to analyse spatial structured genetic data or species data under a unifying framework (Gaggiotti, O. E. et al, 2018, Evol Appl, 11:1176-1193; DOI:10.1111/eva.12593), which partitions diversity and differentiation into any hierarchical levels. It helps you easily structure and format your data. It produces diversity profiles (q=0,1,2), hierarchical diversities and differentiation, as well as the the correlation between geographic distance and genetic differentiation.
